metadata.title: CVE-2022-28948 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue in the Unmarshal function in Go-Yaml v3 causes the program tocrash when attempting to deserialize invalid input.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28948` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.63+22.04ubuntu0.1
snapd - 2.63+22.04ubuntu0.1
snapd-xdg-open - 2.63+22.04ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.63+22.04ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.63+22.04ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-snappy - 2.63+22.04ubuntu0.1
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.63+22.04ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-gopkg-yaml.v3 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
snapd package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.63+22.04ubuntu0.1').
